title: The Sure Thing
excerpt: What successful entrepreneurs have in common.

title: How Larry Gagosian Reshaped the Art World
excerpt: The dealer has been so successful selling art to masters of the universe that he has become one of them.

title: Crime of the Centuries
excerpt: Tomb raiders, crooked art dealers, and museum curators fed billionaire Michael Steinhardt’s addiction to antiquities. Many also happened to be stolen.

title: What you learn about beauty and grief as a guard at the Metropolitan Museum of Art
excerpt: After his brother’s death, Patrick Bringley took a job at the grandest place he could find.

title: Portrait of a killer: art class in one of Mexico’s most notorious prisons
excerpt: The long read: In 2016, artist César Aréchiga talked one of Mexico’s most dangerous maximum security prisons into letting him run art classes for its inmates, many of them violent gang members. Could he really change their lives?

title: The husband-and-wife forgers who fooled the art market — and made millions | CNN
excerpt: Wolfgang and Helene Beltracchi’s forgeries infiltrated museums, auction houses and private collections. A decade after their conviction, psychoanalyst Jeannette Fischer asks: Why did they do it?

title: The Case of the Disputed Lucian Freud
excerpt: A collector thought he had bought a painting by the celebrated British artist. How far would he go to prove it?

title: The Case of the Matisse and the Mysterious Thingamabob
excerpt: Did the artist paint a security camera (or a condom, or a portrait of rigatoni) into “The Red Studio”? An investigation at MoMA looks for clues.

title: Inside the Mind-Boggling World of the Antiquities Theft Task Force
excerpt: You can't make this shit up

title: The Race to Find ‘Green’ Helium
excerpt: Helium is a critical—and finite—resource. The future of our most indispensable technologies depends on a new supply.

title: Tome Raiders: Solving the Great Book Heist
excerpt: When nearly $3.5M of rare books were stolen in an audacious heist at Feltham in 2017, police wondered, what’s the story?

title: The art dealer, the £10m Benin Bronze and the Holocaust
excerpt: Western museums are under pressure to return looted treasure, but what of those in private collections?

title: The 25 Greatest Art Heists of All Time
excerpt: What are the greatest art heists of all time? See a list of the 25 most memorable thefts from museums.

title: The Fall Of Mic Was A Warning | HuffPost
excerpt: "I don’t need a pair of Nikes. I need a 401(k)" -- and other lessons from the death of a venture-backed, Facebook-dependent, millennial-focused news site.

title: How to Spot a Perfect Fake: The World’s Top Art Forgery Detective
excerpt: Forgeries have become so good – and so costly – that Sotheby’s has brought in its own in-house fraud-busting expert.

title: Crossed Stitches
excerpt: Beverly Pennington was a Pinterest-perfect entrepreneur whose patchwork quilts—made from people’s most treasured T-shirts—found thousands of devotees all over the country. But when the quilts stopped coming, leaving the shirts in limbo, her customers pieced together a plan to fight back.

title: Masterpiece Theater
excerpt: A Dutch gallerist made thousands of forgeries and passed them off as the work of real artists. When he was caught, a new con began.

title: How Graffiti Became Gentrified
excerpt: Two decades after Rudy Giuliani tried to rid New York City of graffiti, the art form is flourishing—with unexpected consequences.

title: Buy Low-Tops, Sell High-Tops: A Sneaker Exchange Is Worth $1 Billion
excerpt: StockX is one of several online marketplaces that have turned resales of shoes into a big — and highly valued — business.

title: A US$28 million Picasso masterpiece was missing for 20 years, until the art
excerpt: Art historian Arthur Brand managed to track down the 1983 painting Buste de Femme (Dora Maar), which went missing from a Saudi prince’s boat in 1999.

title: The History of the Color Blue: From Ancient Egypt to the Latest Scientific Discoveries
excerpt: Some scientists believe that the earliest humans were actually colorblind, and had no concept of the color blue.

title: “She Never Looks Back”: Inside Elizabeth Holmes’s Final Months at Theranos
excerpt: At the end, Theranos was overrun by a dog defecating in the boardroom, nearly a dozen law firms on retainer, and a C.E.O. grinning through her teeth about an implausible turnaround.

title: The French Burglar Who Pulled Off His Generation’s Biggest Art Heist
excerpt: The skilled climber and thief Vjeran Tomic, whom the French press referred to as Spider-Man, has described robbery as an act of imagination.

title: Max Cooper - Emergence
excerpt: Emergence is the story of natural laws and processes, their inherent beauty, and their action to yield the universe, us and the world we live in.

title: The Great Chinese Art Heist
excerpt: Is the Chinese government behind one of the boldest art-crime waves in history?

title: An Ohio Startup Rebuilds Lives One Piece of Fried Chicken at a Time - POLIT
excerpt: A millennial entrepreneur hires from inmates and homeless people who struggle to find work even in a strong economy.
